MADNESS.</br>With hundred iron chains he did him bind,</br>An hundred knots that did him sore constrain;</br>Yet his great iron teeth he still did grind,</br>And grimly gnash, threat'ning revenge in vain;</br>His burning eye, which bloody streaks did stain,</br>Stared full wide, and shot forth sparks of fire;</br>And more for rank despite, than for great pain,</br>Shook his long locks, color'd like copper wire,</br>And bit his tawny beard, to shew his raging ire!

</br>GUYON CONDUCTED BY MAMMON THROUGH A SUBTERRANEAN CAVERN TO SEE HIS TREASURE.</br>At length they came into a larger space,</br>That stretch'd itself into an ample plain,</br>Through which a beaten broad highway did trace,</br>That straight did lead to Pluto's gloomy reign;</br>By that way-side there sat infernal Pain,</br>And fast beside him sat tumultuous Strife;</br>The one in hand an iron whip did strain,</br>The other brandished a bloody knife,</br>And both did gnash their teeth, and both did threaten life.

On the other side in one consort there sate</br>Cruel Revenge, and rancorous Despite,</br>Disloyal Treason, and heart-burning Hate;</br>But gnawing Jealousy, out of their sight</br>Sitting alone, his bitter lips did bite:</br>And trembling Fear still to and fro did fly,</br>And found no place where safe he shroud him might.</br>Lamenting Sorrow did in darkness lie,</br>And Shame his ugly face did hide from living eye.

And over them sad Horror, with grim hue</br>Did always soar, beating his iron wings;</br>And after him owls and night ravens flew,</br>The hateful messengers of heavy things,</br>Of death and dolor telling sad tidings;</br>Whilst sad Celeno, sitting on a cliff,</br>A song of bale and bitter sorrows sings,</br>That heart of flint asunder would have rift;</br>Which having ended, after him she flieth swift.</br>
